Healthy Soup Recipes

Find healthy, delicious soup recipes including chicken soup, chowder, gumbo and vegetable soup. Healthier recipes, from the food and nutrition experts at EatingWell.

Our Most Popular Soup Recipe Ever

This veggie-packed minestrone soup recipe is the only weight-loss soup you need.

Crazy-Easy French Onion Soup

Forget spending hours over the stove to make caramelized onions—easily make French onion soup with this genius slow-cooker recipe.

Free Download: 14 Healthy Soup Recipes

We've compiled 14 of our favorite soup recipes into this must-have cookbook.

Southwestern Vegetable & Chicken Soup

8
Who wouldn't want to eat their vegetables when they're tucked into a fragrant broth with bits of tasty chicken and spiked with a shot of fresh lime and cilantro? This healthy chicken vegetable soup seems even richer with the smoky flavor from roasted poblano peppers and garlic. Serve this healthy chicken soup recipe with tortilla chips.

Roasted Tomato and Vegetable Soup

This veggie-packed side-dish soup can be made in the slow cooker. Just make a few tweaks (see Variation).

    • Our Best Pantry Soup Recipes

    Inspiration for making a healthy soup recipe on the fly can be found in a well-stocked pantry. Canned beans and tomatoes, broth, onions and garlic are just a few of the essential ingredients. Here are our favorite soups that get their start with nothing more than what you have on hand.

    • Pureed Soup Recipes for a Blender

    Our healthier versions of traditional soup recipes are delicious meals for lunch and dinner. All of these healthy pureed soup recipes use a blender for a smooth and creamy texture. Try creamy Potato-Leek Bisque or Black Bean Soup for an easy, satisfying meal.

Slow-Cooker Chicken Noodle Soup Meal-Prep Freezer Pack

Not only does this chicken noodle soup recipe utilize the crock pot for a set-it-and-forget-it easy dinner, you can also prep all the ingredients ahead of time and store them away in the freezer to pull out on a day where you forgot to plan dinner. That's a meal-prep win! Just make sure you thaw the food before adding it to the slow cooker--otherwise it will remain at an unsafe temperature for too long.

Sweet Potato Soup with Toasted Pecans

Thick and creamy, yet low in calories, this soup makes a great side dish for beef, pork, or chicken.

Pasta e Fagioli

This is the classic Italian soup recipe (pasta and beans in a tomato base), though we've reduced the sodium and swapped in whole-grain pasta. Tailor it to your taste with anchovy and crushed red pepper as desired.

Pumpkin Spice Butternut Squash Soup

Simmer up a light and tasty fall soup, made creamy with coconut milk and Greek yogurt.

Miso Soup Cup of Noodles with Shrimp & Green Tea Soba

Green tea soba noodles, or cha soba, are buckwheat noodles made with powdered green tea, which imparts a subtle grassy note and pretty color. You can find them in Japanese markets or online. Regular buckwheat soba noodles work just as well in this cup-of-noodles-style mason jar noodle soup.

José Andrés's Gazpacho

Gazpacho is a delicious way to eat more veggies. Think of it as a vegetable smoothie. Not only does Chef José Andrés keep a pitcher of this healthy gazpacho recipe in his refrigerator all summer, it's also served at Beefsteak, his chain of vegetable-driven restaurants.

Kielbasa & Cabbage Soup

4
This Eastern European soup (called kapusniak in Polish) is traditionally made with sauerkraut. To keep the sodium in check in this healthy recipe, we use fresh cabbage and save the sauerkraut for a deliciously salty-sour garnish.

Spicy Ramen Cup of Noodles

6
Make your own cup of instant soup at home with this vegetarian ramen recipe. Pack several jars at once to take to work for easy lunches throughout the week.

Veggistrone

30
This vegetable-packed minestrone soup recipe is inspired by a popular Weight Watchers vegetable soup recipe. It makes a big pot of soup, so keep some in the refrigerator for up to 5 days and freeze the rest of the vegetable minestrone soup in single-serve portions. That way you always have an easy, delicious vegetable soup to start your meal or to eat for lunch. Think of this vegetable minestrone recipe as a starting point for other healthy soup variations, too: toss in leftover chopped cooked chicken or whole-wheat pasta or brown rice to make it more satisfying.

Black Bean Soup

37
This is a zippy Southwestern-flavored black bean soup. We make it with canned beans so it comes together in minutes. If you have leftovers, pack them up in individual serving containers for lunch the next day.

Fresh Corn & Red Pepper Bisque

5
Use the freshest and sweetest ears you can find for this corn and red pepper bisque. We use just a bit of reduced-fat sour cream in this soup to give it a creamy body, without the heavy cream usually used in a bisque.

Southwestern Vegetable Chowder

3
In this healthy vegetable chowder recipe, heavy cream is replaced with milk and flour-thickened vegetable broth and we keep sodium amounts reasonable with lower-sodium broth. By making your own creamy vegetarian chowder, you'll save up to 300 calories, 20 grams of saturated fat and 500 milligrams of sodium per serving compared to many store-bought or restaurant chowders.

Chilly Dilly Cucumber Soup

1
This cold cucumber-dill soup has a surprisingly seductive taste. The secret is that both the broth and the yogurt garnish are loaded with fresh (never dried) dill and chives. Serve as a starter or a light lunch entree. The recipe calls for “handfuls” of herbs; if you are relying on the grocery store instead of the garden or farmers' market, you'll need about one large bunch or one to two 2- to 3-ounce packets. Recipe by Nancy Baggett for EatingWell.

Creamy Turnip Soup

3
In this recipe, the humble turnip is transformed into a rich turnip soup made creamy with just 1 tablespoon of butter. Serve it as a starter or side soup. The mini salad on top is optional, but we love the bit of texture from the greens and pop of flavor from the vinaigrette.

Fragrant Fish Soup

12
Lemony rice, delicately flavored broth and gently poached tilapia are topped with a colorful blend of vegetables and herbs. The aromatic mint provides fresh and complex flavor.

Hot & Sour Soup with Crab

1
A favorite Sichuan-style opener becomes a main course with the addition of crabmeat. Dried tiger-lily buds (also called Golden Needles), cloud ears and Sichuan peppercorns can be found in Aisan markets or ordered from orientalpantry.com or amazon.com.

Louisiana Gumbo

10
Chock-full of shrimp, chicken, sausage, okra and tomatoes, this flavorful stew is a staple in Louisiana. Make it a meal: Serve with Real Cornbread.

Chicken & Rice Soup

4
This is a great, easy chicken-and-rice soup. We like to use instant brown rice because it cooks so quickly, but you could substitute cooked brown rice (stirred in at the end) if you have it on hand. Try the recipe with other herbs if you like, such as dill or tarragon.Chicken
ADVERTISEMENT

Tortellini in a Rosemary-Scented Broth

Infusing canned broth with garlic, rosemary and crushed red pepper adds a quick punch of flavor; storebought tortellini makes it substantial enough to serve as a main course. Make it a meal: Warm Arugula Bread Salad completes this meal.

Portuguese Bread & Garlic Soup (Acorda)

This traditional Portuguese peasant soup is perfect for using up day-old bread.

Crab Bisque with Avocado, Tomato & Corn Relish

11
Our light version of classic crab bisque gets its creaminess from a combination of low-fat milk plus pureed vegetables and potatoes. The tangy, chunky relish provides a textural and flavor contrast to the smoky, rich-tasting bisque. Serve with crusty whole-grain rolls and some extra wedges of lime for squeezing.

Salmon Chowder

28
The flavor of this salmon chowder is greatly enhanced by adding either fresh dill or dried tarragon: each herb lends its own distinctively different and appealing character to the soup. Even if you don't keep instant mashed potatoes in your pantry, it's worth picking some up for this soup. They give the soup a thick, chowder texture without any heavy cream or butter. Leftover mashed potatoes work too, but give a slightly less-velvety texture. Recipe by Nancy Baggett for EatingWell.

Chilled Melon Soup

3
This refreshing summer soup is a great starter for dinner on the patio on a summer evening. Try any variety of melon in this recipe. Serve leftover soup with salad for lunch the next day.

Bean & Barley Soup

17
This hearty bean and barley soup tastes like it has simmered for hours, but actually it's quite quick to throw together. Plus this recipe for healthy bean and barley soup freezes beautifully. If you have cooked barley on hand, omit the quick-cooking barley and stir in 1 1/2 cups cooked barley along with the broth in Step 2.

Jamaican Curried Shrimp & Mango Soup

9
Transport yourself to the islands with this Jamaican-inspired soup, full of fresh shrimp and sweet mangoes. We loved this soup with regular store-bought curry powder, but if you happen to have Jamaican-style curry powder, which has a hint of allspice, this is a great place to use it. Serve with brown basmati or jasmine rice with sliced pineapple for dessert.

Paprika & Red Pepper Soup with Pistachio Puree

13
Richly satisfying, this luscious-looking soup made with red bell peppers gets a touch of heat from Thai chile. For an extra-nutty flavor, puree an additional 1/4 cup shelled pistachios with 1/4 cup water and serve the soup with a dollop of this pistachio puree on top.

Chicken Mulligatawny

13
Mulligatawny, which literally means “pepper water,” is an English interpretation of an Indian dish. It has seemingly limitless versions, but most have curry and a bit of chicken. We've added tart Granny Smith apples, plenty of spice and a touch of coconut milk.
ADVERTISEMENT

Cumin-Scented Wheat Berry-Lentil Soup

20
Freshly squeezed lemon juice adds a bright note to this toothsome and hearty winter soup, perfect for a weeknight supper with a hunk of crusty bread. It freezes beautifully--you can keep individual portions in the freezer for healthy weekday lunches. For homemade vegetable broth, see Roasted Vegetable Stock at eatingwell.com.

New England Clam Chowder

21
Chopped clams, aromatic vegetables and creamy potatoes blended with low-fat milk and just a half cup of cream gives this chunky New England-style clam chowder plenty of rich body. Serve with oyster crackers and a tossed salad to make it a meal.

Amazing Pea Soup

Sometimes the peas in the garden outpace the picking or the supplies in the store aren't so fabulous. Here's a recipe for those less-than-perfect peas--no shucking involved. A soup for the true pea lover.

Greek Chicken & Vegetable Ragout

42
Chicken thighs stay moist and succulent during slow cooking, infusing the accompanying vegetables with superb flavor. This easy braise has a luxurious finish of avgolémono, a versatile Greek sauce made with egg, lemon and fresh dill.
ADVERTISEMENT

Grilled Tomato Gazpacho

4
Grill the vegetables for this refreshing soup earlier in the day or even the night before. We sometimes serve the gazpacho in clear Spanish wine tumblers to show off the rich color.

Spiced Blueberry Soup

2
Delightful and refreshing, this chilled soup works as an appetizer, dessert or snack. If using frozen blueberries, cover the pan in Step 1 to bring the cold blueberry mixture to a boil more quickly.

Vegetable Lover's Chicken Soup

13
Classic comfort food is yours, in just slightly more than half an hour. Serve with some crusty whole-grain bread and top with grated Romano or Parmesan cheese.

Herbed Zucchini Soup

34
This is one of the few soups that make the cut in summer. Serve it chilled to take the edge off a hot August night.

Vietnamese-Style Beef & Noodle Broth

23
Inspired by pho--a traditional Vietnamese soup--this one-pot meal is garnished with crunchy mung bean sprouts and chopped fresh basil. You could also serve it with lime wedges and a bottle of Asian chile sauce, such as sriracha, on the side.

Italian Peasant Soup with Cabbage, Beans & Cheese

10
A well-stocked pantry is a good starting point for making a hearty homemade soup like this one--just add some fresh vegetables, bread and cheese and you've got dinner (and tomorrow's lunch).

Eggs Baked Over a Spicy Vegetable Ragout

2
This rustic dish typifies Mediterranean home cooking at its best: a full-flavored vegetable stew is topped with eggs to become a main dish. Any hot sauce you have on hand will add a nice jolt of heat, but for a complex, authentic flavor, try harissa, a chile paste from North Africa.

Oyster Bisque

This oyster soup bursts with the heady flavors of the sea. Rather than heavy cream, this recipe uses pureed rice to add body and the mellow sweetness needed to balance the oysters. It makes an elegant starter for a dinner party.

Pasta & Chickpea Soup (Pasta e ceci)

2
This thick soup is full of chickpeas, tomatoes, fresh rosemary and pasta. Convenient pantry items makes it the perfect solution for harried weeknights.
ADVERTISEMENT

Pesto Chicken & Cannellini Bean Soup

1
This healthy, Italian-inspired chicken soup recipe is loaded with fiber-rich vegetables and beans and gets an extra boost of flavor from a swirl of pesto at the end. To get a homemade stock flavor using store-bought broth, we simmer bone-in chicken breasts in the broth before adding the rest of the soup ingredients.

Japanese Chicken Noodle Soup

1
This healthy, Japanese-inspired chicken noodle soup recipe is made with udon noodles and gets a hit of umami flavor from a swirl of miso at the end. To make the miso easier to stir into the soup, combine a little bit of the hot broth with the thick miso to thin it before adding to the rest of the soup.

Mushroom & Herb Matzo Ball Soup

With the addition of flavorful mushrooms, celery root, garlic, herbs and spices, this matzo ball soup recipe has more vegetables and less sodium than a traditional recipe.
ADVERTISEMENT

Shrimp & Chinese Chive Wonton Soup

This recipe for homemade wontons makes it easy to make a healthy version of the famous Chinese wonton soup at home. Look for wonton wrappers in the refrigerated section of your supermarket near the fresh noodles or tofu and go for the square ones (not round). Leftover wrappers can be wrapped airtight and frozen for up to 1 month.

Slow-Cooker Spanish Chickpea Soup

2
This easy soup recipe is inspired by cocido, the hearty stew of assorted meats, chickpeas and vegetables considered a national dish of Spain. Each region, family and restaurant has its own variation, but this slow-cooker soup has enough meat to satisfy the carnivores and enough vegetables to make it healthy. Ask for a 4-ounce slab of Serrano ham or prosciutto at your deli counter instead of buying slices. If you don't have a 6-quart (or larger) slow cooker, opt for the stovetop variation instead.

Indian Saag with Chickpeas

4
Paneer, a fresh cheese that tastes like a cross between mozzarella and feta, is a common ingredient in vegetarian Indian recipes. To make this healthy Indian spinach recipe vegan, substitute tofu for the paneer and use “lite” coconut milk instead of yogurt.

Spiced Cauliflower Soup

2
The toasted spices in this creamy cauliflower soup recipe make this dish warm, rich and flavorful. You can deepen the color further by making it with a head of orange cauliflower, sometimes labeled “Cheddar.”

Chickpea, Chorizo & Spinach Soup

8
Chorizo lends this Mediterranean-inspired spinach soup recipe a smoky paprika flavor, and since the chorizo is sautéed first, much of the fat is drained away. Be sure to buy dry-cured, salami-style Spanish chorizo, not soft, Mexican-style sausage by the same name.

Yellow Gazpacho

The yellow vegetables of summer--fresh corn, yellow tomatoes and yellow peppers--make this slightly sweet gazpacho soup recipe a beautiful and delicious alternative to red gazpacho.

Slow-Cooker Moroccan Lentil Soup

45
Like most soups, this Moroccan lentil soup recipe gets better with time as the complex seasonings have time to develop. Make it a day ahead if you can--this easy slow cooker/crock pot recipe variation makes it a cinch to get the soup cooking while you do other things.

Old-Fashioned Winter Vegetable Chowder

2
This wonderful winter vegetable chowder recipe is rich, filling and great for a winter supper. This winter vegetable chowder is full of potatoes, rutabaga and carrot, but other vegetables could be added, such as sauteed mushrooms or fennel, chopped tomatoes or cubes of roasted winter squash. This recipe makes more Cream Sauce without the Cream than you'll need for the chowder. Refrigerate or freeze the extra sauce and use it in place of heavy cream in any sauce or soup that calls for cream.
ADVERTISEMENT

Pork, Apple & Miso Noodle Soup for Two

Apples and mild white miso lightly sweeten this easy one-pot soup. It's got plenty of flavor with few ingredients, but feel free to add sliced scallions for a refreshing crunch or a dash of hot sauce for zing. Serve with toasted baguette with melted Cheddar cheese and a watercress salad.

Ribollita Soup

8
Ribollita, a traditional hearty Tuscan soup, typically uses day-old bread to add body and thicken the broth. This ribollita recipe uses a bean mash, which keeps the soup gluten-free and adds fiber. Garnish with extra-virgin olive oil or pepper and grated Parmesan.

Couscous Paella Soup

1
This soup is inspired by the flavors and ingredients of paella, but unlike paella it's simple enough for a speedy weeknight dinner. If you can't find Spanish chorizo, use pepperoni (add a pinch of smoked paprika if you have it). Serve with warm whole-grain garlic bread.

Green Soup with Yams & Sage

8
This kale and spinach soup has a beautiful complexity. It's slightly sweet, with a bright note of lemon and the subtle aromatics of thyme, sage and garlic. Japanese yams are marvelously flavorful; they have a dark purplish skin and are snow-white inside. Ask for them at your farmers' market or grocery, but if they are unavailable, regular sweet potatoes can be substituted. Recipe by Anna Thomas for EatingWell.

Smoky Black Bean Soup

13
This will probably be the most hauntingly delicious black bean soup you've ever tasted. The coffee adds a slightly toasty, woodsy background note. The optional ham hock adds smoky, salty ham flavor. Serve with a mixed green salad or a grilled cheese sandwich with pickled jalapeños. Recipe by Joyce Hendley for EatingWell.

Seafood Chowder Casserole

14
New England seafood chowder inspired the flavors here, but we've enhanced them further with Gruyère cheese and a crispy crumb topping. We like the combination of shrimp, cod and crab, but feel free to experiment with other types of seafood--scallops, clams and mahi-mahi would also work well.

Quick Pepperpot Soup

3
Jamaican pepperpot soup is usually a long-simmered preparation made with tough cuts of meat and vegetables. This version uses quick-cooking sirloin instead to get it on the table fast. If you're not a fan of beef, try the soup with shrimp instead.

Pureed Broccoli Soup

22
Try this easy broccoli soup alongside grilled cheese sandwiches or as a starter for a simple supper.

Tomatillo Gazpacho

5
This tomatillo-based gazpacho is gorgeously green with a tart flavor that complements the sweet shrimp and salty olives. Make this meatless by substituting ricotta salata or feta for the shrimp. Serve with: Cheese quesadillas.

Scallops in Saffron-Tarragon Broth

3
Los tomates, el estragón y el vino blanco hacen un caldo fragante para las vieiras en este guiso de una sola olla de colores vibrantes y fáciles. Haga que sea una comida: sirva con una simple ensalada verde y cocine el caldo sobrante con baguette integral tostado.

Apple Turkey Picadillo

22
Este giro en el alimento básico de América Latina se vuelve más saludable con pavo molido sin grasa y manzanas crujientes. Dobla bien. Trate de meterlo en tortillas de trigo integral o sirva sobre arroz integral instantáneo para una cena rápida y saludable.

Sopa de maíz de tilapia

14
Esta sopa liviana es una gran manera de deslizar maíz fresco (¡y tilapia, por supuesto!) En su menú de finales de verano. Haga que sea una comida: disfrute con una ensalada verde mixta y galletas de ostras.

Chowder de pescado cremoso

6
La leche baja en grasa y el puré de papas hacen que este chowder sea tan rico y cremoso que no se perderá la crema real. La tilapia criada en granjas y el abundante bacalao del Pacífico, ambos con texturas tiernas y escamosas, son opciones que favorecen los océanos.

Bullabesa con Spicy Rouille

2
Este famoso guiso provenzal fue tradicionalmente un abanico para la pesca de los pescadores del día. Nuestra versión utiliza calamares, tilapia y vieiras amigables con el océano.
ADVERTISEMENT

Curry rojo con verduras

15
La pasta de curry Thai roja, que saborea este plato, es una combinación conveniente de chile, ajo, hierba de limón y galanga (una raíz que es similar en sabor al jengibre). Puede empacar mucho calor, así que asegúrese de probar sobre la marcha. Busque la pasta de curry en tarros o latas en la sección asiática del supermercado o tienda especializada. Haz que sea una comida: coloca el estofado sobre el arroz para absorber cada una de las deliciosas salsas.

Stock de verduras asadas

Tostar las verduras produce resultados ricos y sabrosos.

Escarola y sopa de frijoles blancos

8
No tengas miedo de la escarola, que parece lechuga romana ligeramente fruncida, porque se cuece en un verde dulce y tierno. Si no puede encontrarlo, sustituya una bolsa de espinacas de 10 onzas. Make It a Meal: pan crujiente caliente y una ensalada verde son un excelente acompañamiento.

Cuenco de arroz japonés con cebollín y cebolla de verdeo

54
Aquí está la quintaesencia de la cocina casera japonesa: un caldo aromático rico en proteínas servido con arroz. Es cierto que la cocina japonesa se basa en gran medida en el azúcar, por un sabor menos tradicional, puede reducir o incluso omitir el azúcar.

Sopa de pavo y cebada

La cebada nuez y los vegetales de raíz terrosos y dulces complementan el pavo sobrante para crear una sopa hogareña con un sabor anticuado. Para acortar el tiempo de cocción, sustituya la cebada perlada por cebada de cocción rápida; agregue zanahorias y chirivías con la cebada y cocine a fuego lento la sopa durante aproximadamente 20 minutos en total.

Sopa de zanahoria y manzana al curry

5
Esta colorida sopa es simple y deliciosa. Use manzanas que cocinan suave; McIntosh son geniales.

Sopa de guisantes y cebolleta

1
Puede usar guisantes frescos o congelados, ya sea que contengan vitaminas B, hierro y fibra, en esta sopa, pero si se toma el tiempo de cocer los guisantes frescos, se le recompensará con un sabor especial brillante y elástico.

Sopa de tortilla de maíz

Esta sopa rápida es un gran uso para las tortillas de maíz sobrantes. Sirve como un ligero aperitivo para cualquier comida mexicana.

Sopa de pollo al curry

2
El curry en polvo, el jengibre fresco y el ajo infunden esta sopa de pollo con mucho sabor.

Chowder de maíz y pimienta

El pollo o marisco cocido sería una buena adición a esta sopa. Para un sabor aún más rico, saltee el maíz primero en una cucharadita de aceite hasta que esté ligeramente dorado.

Quick Posole

1
En Nuevo México y Arizona, el pozole se hace generalmente con caldo de puerco casero y se sirve en las celebraciones. Para una comida rápida entre semana, elija pollo y condimente con chile rojo molido y orégano tostado.
ADVERTISEMENT

Sopa de pollo coreana

4
Esta receta rápida y fácil de sopa de pollo picante está hecha con pollo sobrante cocido y está enriquecida con ajo, jengibre y salsa picante.

Recursos pesqueros

Es difícil encontrar una población de peces comercial, aunque algunos mercados de pescado pueden ofrecer una reserva congelada. Busque cabezas y huesos en el mostrador de pescado de su tienda de comestibles.

Chowder de verduras de raíz de cebada

4
Esta abundante sopa está llena de tubérculos: raíz de apio, colinabo, zanahorias y chirivías. La sopa de pescado está hecha con caldo de carne de res, pero el caldo de verduras se puede utilizar en su lugar para hacer una versión vegetariana. Esta receta de sabor robusto hace 12 porciones de primer curso. O sirva porciones de tamaño doble junto con una ensalada y pan crujiente para la cena.

Muslos de pollo estofados a la sartén con garbanzos

2
Este plato con cuerpo es oriundo de la región catalana de España. Los muslos de pollo se mantienen húmedos y jugosos cuando se los recalienta, por lo que es un buen candidato para avanzar.
ADVERTISEMENT

Sopa de champiñones y crema agria

2
Esta versión saludable de la crema de champiñones utiliza crema agria con poca grasa y leche baja en grasa para que quede cremosa mientras se mantiene la grasa bajo control. Estragón fresco y nuez moscada sabor muy bien.

Sopa de zanahoria de Sichuan

6
Los sabores distintivos de la cocina de la provincia de Sichuan en China - maní, ajonjolí, pimiento rojo, jengibre y ajo - juegan contra un fondo de zanahorias dulces en esta hermosa sopa de naranja bruñida.

Sopa de verduras a la parrilla mediterránea

1

Dashi

1
Dried kelp and bonito flakes, briefly simmered, create a delicate amber broth called “first” or “primary” dashi, the basis for most clear soups in Japan. For “second” dashi, the kelp and bonito are added to a new pot of water (like a used tea bag), making a weaker stock to be used in boldly seasoned dishes like miso soup. Although instant dashi granules and bottles of concentrated dashi are timesaving substitutes, the taste is less subtle and refined than dashi made from scratch.

    • Our Best Veggie-Packed Soup Recipes

    There isn't a more delicious and satisfying way to get more veggies into your diet than a big bowl of soup. These healthy soup recipes boast at least a full 1-cup serving of vegetables per bowl. That's important because most of us don't get enough. Here are recipes that help you ladle your way to better health.

Slow-Cooker Vegetable Soup

1
Make a big batch of low-calorie veggie-packed soup with ease in this load-and-go crock pot recipe. After simmering away in the slow cooker, portion it into individual serving containers and store in the fridge or freezer for fast, healthy lunches or an easy, satisfying snack. This weight-loss vegetable soup fills you up without a lot of calories, plus it's an easy way to eat more vegetables.

Sausage, Brussels Sprout & Potato Soup

2
Bake up some Manchego cheese toasts and uncork a bottle of Ribera del Duero to enjoy alongside this healthy pot of soup. Both sweet and hot Italian sausage work well.

Carrots, baby sweet peas, and green onions are added to the traditional egg drop soup in this recipe.

The barley adds texture, flavor, and a healthy dose of fiber to this heart-healthy main-dish soup recipe.

Sichuan Ramen Cup of Noodles with Cabbage & Tofu

The Sichuan province in the southwestern corner of China is known for its fiery dishes. Here, the richness of tahini tempers the spicy chile paste in this cup-of-noodles-style mason jar soup recipe. You can grind the Sichuan peppercorns in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle, or crush them with the bottom of a heavy skillet.

Split Pea Soup with Chorizo

For this easy slow-cooker split pea soup, look for raw smoky, spicy chorizo. If you can't find raw chorizo, Italian sausage or merguez makes a fine substitute.

Cauliflower Soup

Leftover cauliflower from dinner? Blend it up into a creamy, flavorful soup to pack for lunch.

Cucumber-Almond Gazpacho

Not all gazpachos are red. In this healthy white gazpacho recipe, we use cucumbers, yellow bell pepper and unsweetened almond milk for more savory results.

Green Curry Vegetable Soup

In this very easy Thai noodle soup recipe, just pour hot curry-flavored broth over pasta and veggies. The vegetables keep their crunch and you get a quick, satisfying soup. Feel free to add chicken, shrimp or tofu for an extra bit of protein, if desired.

Thai Coconut Curry Soup

This healthy version of tom kha soup is vegetarian and flavored with Thai red curry paste. Instead of using fish sauce, we simmer dried shiitakes in vegetable broth to add an umami note.

Cioppino Soup

1
What bouillabaisse is to Provence, cioppino is to San Francisco. The principle behind both fish stews is much the same: simmer the catch of the day in a rich broth, grab a soup spoon and enjoy. Like many classic cioppino recipes, this calls for red wine in the broth, but feel free to substitute white. The assortment of seafood can vary as well: little clams instead of mussels, scallops in place of shrimp. Serve with sourdough bread.

Cioppino

1
Cioppino is a fish stew traditionally made by Italian fishermen who settled in the North Beach/Fisherman's Wharf section of San Francisco. It was originally made on fishing boats with whatever fish were at hand. This cioppino comes to us from California chef and cooking teacher John Ash, who has been an advocate for sustainable-food issues for years and has served on the board of advisors of Seafood Watch--the advocacy arm of the Monterey Bay Aquarium. Ash chose a variety of shellfish for this recipe, all of which are Seafood Watch Best Choices or Good Alternatives.

    Make a rainy-day dinner fund by loading up your freezer with these healthy freezable soup recipes. Then if your dinner plan is derailed, all you have to do is turn to your freezer for an easy meal. Toss a salad, warm up some bread and dinner is served. And for grab-and-go convenience, freeze single servings to bring for lunch too. Some soups freeze better than others, so here are our picks for the best ones you should stock up on.

2
Pureed artichoke hearts in addition to eggs thicken this delectable version of the classic Greek soup, avgolemono. The lemony broth and rice remain as they do in the original. Wilted spinach adds extra color and nutrients.

Manhattan Crab Chowder

2
Manhattan chowder is the red kind, made with disease-fighting lycopene-rich tomatoes. This version substitutes crab for the clams. To make it cook faster, take your time to finely dice the vegetables. We call for convenient canned crushed tomatoes, but you only need 2 cups; store leftover tomatoes in an airtight container for 1 week in the refrigerator or months in the freezer. Then take them out to toss into other soups or sauces--you can't go wrong with adding tomatoes, from a heart-health perspective! All you need is crusty bread or oyster crackers and a tossed salad and you've got dinner.

Collard Green & Black-Eyed Pea Soup

23
Antioxidant-rich collard greens and fiber-packed black-eyed peas have a starring role in this nutritious soup. There's no need for loads of ham or salt pork--just a small amount of bacon gives it a wonderful smoky flavor. You can skip the bacon and substitute vegetable broth for chicken broth for a great vegetarian dish.

Golden Gazpacho

1
Inspired by Spanish pureed gazpachos, this golden-yellow one is based on an idea of Greg Parks's at the Four Columns Inn in Newfane, Vermont.

Quick French Onion Soup

1
Bring the allium family--onions, leeks, garlic--together in this simpler and heartier version of French onion soup. If you've always found the traditional melted cheese topping too intimidating to try at home, you'll find this version user-friendly; just top toasted bread with cheese and pour the soup over to melt it. Including chickpeas makes it filling enough for a main course.

Miso Vegetable Soup

Tofu, rice and plenty of vegetables transform miso soup from a light accompaniment into a dish that's substantial enough to leave you feeling satisfied.

Chilled Tomato Soup with Cilantro-Yogurt Swirl

This fresh take on gazpacho--a chilled tomato soup--is spiked with chopped chipotle peppers, which add a deep, smoky heat to the dish. The cilantro-yogurt swirl balances the heat from the chiles and makes a beautiful garnish. Serve this soup as a starter for dinner on a warm summer evening..

Greek Lemon Rice Soup

7
Smooth silken tofu replaces the eggs in our version of the classic Greek soup. Add an extra drizzle of olive oil on top of each portion to give it an extra-luxurious taste.
ADVERTISEMENT

Mexican Soup

2
Try this thick main-dish soup--full of chickpeas, tomatoes, lean ground beef and spices--with cornbread.

Caribbean Pork Curry (Porc Colombo)

Curry was brought to the Caribbean by British colonizers and the Indians they brought with them to work the sugar plantations. Our version uses lean, quick-cooking lean pork tenderloin.

Artichoke Soup

Whisking an egg yolk at the end yields a creamy, decadent result in this lemony artichoke soup. Make it a meal: Make Tomato-Basil Finger Sandwiches while the artichokes are simmering and dinner is ready in a snap!

Agedashi Salmon with Snow Peas, Shiitakes & Salmon Roe

A twist on the classic Japanese dish, this healthy fish recipe swaps wild salmon for the traditional tofu. This agedashi gets extra kick from shichimi togarashi, a Japanese chile pepper blend, available in well-stocked markets or online. Serve alongside brown rice or udon noodles and a seaweed salad.

Double Celery Soup

1
Roasting celery and celery root intensifies their flavors in this silky-smooth, healthy soup recipe. Serve topped with a swirl of yogurt and herbs or a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil.
ADVERTISEMENT

Classic Chicken Soup

Classic chicken noodle soup gets a healthy upgrade with low-sodium chicken broth, whole-wheat egg noodles and tons of vegetables. To get a homemade stock flavor using store-bought broth, we simmer bone-in chicken breasts in the broth before adding the rest of the soup ingredients.

Rhubarb & Lamb Tagine

In this healthy lamb stew recipe, rhubarb contributes a savory-tart flavor. Pork shoulder would be good in place of the lamb if you prefer. Serve over whole-wheat couscous or an aromatic brown rice, such as basmati or jasmine.

Chicken & Gnocchi Dumplings for Two

Here we use tender gnocchi in place of homemade dumplings in this rich and warming chicken and vegetable stew recipe. Freeze the remaining 8 ounces of gnocchi in an airtight container for another meal.
ADVERTISEMENT

Serbian Chicken & Eggplant Soup

6
This healthy eggplant and chicken soup recipe, inspired by traditional Serbian cuisine, is seasoned with lemon, herbs, turmeric and two types of paprika. It's packed with vegetables, so the only side you'll need is crusty bread to sop up the delicious broth.

Celeriac & Apple Soup with Blue Cheese Toasts

In this easy, make-ahead apple soup recipe, celeriac (celery root) and apples are roasted to intensify their flavor before being pureed. The blue cheese toasts on top add a little something special, but you could forgo them for chopped toasted pecans.

Creamy Radish Soup

3
In this creamy radish soup recipe, radishes are sautéed and pureed with potato, creating a velvety, healthy soup. Cooking radishes also tones down any bitterness, while leaving plenty of sweet, earthy flavors to enjoy. Using smaller radishes will give the soup a pretty pink hue, like the one pictured here, while larger radishes result in an almost white soup.

Winter Vegetable Dal

10
This southern-Indian-inspired vegetable dal recipe is rich and creamy thanks to light coconut milk and gets exotic flavor from spice-infused coconut oil. Serve with flatbread or naan.

Loaded Baked Potato Soup

11
This healthy loaded baked potato soup recipe is inspired by the comforting flavor of fully loaded baked potatoes with bacon, Cheddar, sour cream and chives. To make a vegetarian version of this potato soup, omit the bacon and use “no-chicken” broth. Serve it with a green salad and crusty bread to clean up the bowl.
ADVERTISEMENT

Quinoa Peanut Soup (Sopa de Mani)

17
This spicy vegetable, quinoa and peanut soup recipe is a modern take on a traditional Bolivian soup recipe called Sopa de Mani. Serve this healthy quinoa soup recipe as a starter or make it a heartier meal by adding diced cooked chicken or turkey breast to the soup.

Italian Wedding Soup

12
This Italian Wedding Soup recipe is Italian comfort food at its best, and this easy soup recipe lends itself to countless variations. Substitute spinach, chicory, chard or any other leafy green for the escarole or kale, and any leftover cooked (or canned) beans for the white beans in this healthy Italian wedding soup recipe.

Seafood Gumbo

1
Gumbo, a hearty stew made with anything from sausage or duck to rabbit or seafood, starts with a roux cooked until it turns dark and nutty, giving the stew recipe its signature earthy flavor. This crab and shrimp gumbo recipe comes from Eula Mae Doré, who was the cook at the Commissary on Avery Island, home to the Tabasco company. She learned Cajun cooking by watching, rather than from cookbooks. Serve with brown rice. (Recipe adapted from Eula Mae's Cajun Kitchen by Eula Mae Doré and Marcelle R. Bienvenu; Harvard Common Press, 2007.)

Celery & Parmesan Minestrone

3
This simple healthy minestrone soup recipe cooks in less than 30 minutes and uses celery stalks, leaves and dried celery seed to flavor the delicious Parmesan-laced tomato broth.
ADVERTISEMENT

Very Green Lentil Soup

15
Lentils seem to go well with just about anything, and here they play well with a collection of greens and some cumin and coriander to add a gentle spicy note to this soup recipe. The result is a hearty winter soup with layers of flavor. Both French green lentils (available in natural-foods stores and specialty markets) and more commonly available brown lentils are delicious in this soup. The French green lentils hold their shape better when cooked, while brown lentils will start to break down a bit. Recipe by Anna Thomas for EatingWell.
ADVERTISEMENT

Green Curry Soup

6
This aromatic green curry soup is packed with spinach, mushrooms, green beans and broccoli stems (save the florets for another night). Green curry paste gives this soup a delicately spicy broth. The vegetables are cooked just enough to be tender, but retain their freshness and distinct textures. Recipe by Anna Thomas for EatingWell.

Potato-Artichoke Soup

5
This luxurious potato-artichoke soup is simple enough to be served with a salad for dinner, yet turns into an elegant first course when you top it with a slice of garlic-rubbed crostini smeared with olive tapenade.

Seaweed & Tofu Soup

2
Korean meals always include soups--like this mild one based on vitamin-rich wakame seaweed, the same kind often used in miso soup.

Cheddar Cauliflower Soup

35
Start your meal off with a bowl of this satisfying, easy cheesy cauliflower soup.

Spring Chicken & Barley Soup

15
You might think of barley as an addition to hearty, wintery soups, such as mushroom-barley or beef-barley soup, but it also works well in lighter soups like this one with chicken, asparagus and peas.

Thai Bouillabaisse

2
This flavorful seafood soup combines elements of the famous French bouillabaisse with the distinct Thai flavors of lemongrass, lime, ginger and hot chiles. Use two chile peppers if you like heat. Be sure to simmer, not boil, the soup or the seafood will be overcooked. Serve with a crusty whole-grain baguette to soak up the broth.

Ginger, Split Pea & Vegetable Curry (Subzi dalcha)

14
Protein-rich yellow split peas combined with fresh vegetables yields a hearty, stewlike curry--perfect for a cold winter night by the fireplace, with a loaf of crusty bread. Try any combination of vegetables--sweet potatoes, winter squash and spinach create a sweeter offering. Don't be alarmed by the number of chiles--the vegetables and split peas bring the heat level down to make each bite addictive without being excessively hot.
ADVERTISEMENT

Sausage Soup

3
Chock-full of vegetables, thick with kidney beans and gently seasoned with garlic and anise, this soup typifies the Portuguese way of cooking. It needs only about 30 minutes to simmer.

Hungarian Apple Soup

7
Esta sabrosa sopa de manzana para dos obtiene cuerpo de papas Yukon Gold y un toque de calor del pimentón. Flote algunos camarones de cóctel o un montículo de carne de cangrejo en cada plato para convertirlo en un plato principal.
ADVERTISEMENT

Stock de pollo casero rico

1
Nos encanta usar un caldo de pollo conveniente, comprado en la tienda, pero hacer uno propio es más fácil de lo que piensas y el sabor completo vale la pena el esfuerzo. En esta receta, utilizamos cuartos económicos de pierna de pollo y cocinamos a fuego lento el caldo lo suficiente para desarrollar un sabor ultra rico. Además, no hay sodio agregado en la receta, solo sal según sus preferencias personales. Si tiene dos almacenes u hornos holandeses grandes, considere hacer dos lotes y congelar uno: estará feliz de haberlo hecho.

Sopa de Cheddar-Cerveza

21
Nuestra sopa de patatas con queso y cerveza tiene solo una fracción de la grasa y el sodio de una receta tradicional. Usamos leche baja en grasa y solo un poco de aceite y mantenemos el sabor fuerte con queso Cheddar fuerte y afrutado. Las papas en cubos precocidas, que puede obtener en muchos supermercados, mantienen esta receta muy rápida. Las papas rojas en cubitos regulares también funcionan; solo necesitará aumentar el tiempo de cocción.

Cóctel de camarones a la parrilla con salsa amarilla de gazpacho

3
Los tomates amarillos tienen una acidez menor que sus primos rojos y varias variedades se encuentran entre las primeras de la temporada en madurar. Aquí se combinan con pepino fresco y pimientos amarillos en una salsa refrescante. El camarón a la parrilla hace de este plato una versión más elegante y con sabor completo del cóctel de camarones.

Gazpacho de sandía

5
Los delicados sabores del pepino y la sandía van de la mano para crear una sopa fría dulce y salada, perfecta como primer plato en una noche calurosa.

Sopa de espárragos

3
Esta sopa crepped pero aún cremosa es un gran almuerzo o una cena de verano por la noche, pero también puedes darle cuchara sobre la carne de cangrejo, el camarón cocido o el tofu en cubos para una comida más pesada.

Caldo de pavo esencial

1
Una vez que haya quitado la carne de pavo sobrante para sándwiches y cazuelas, conviértala en un caldo para sopa, como la sopa de pavo y cebada.

Sopa de pollo con fideos con eneldo

29
La sopa de fideos de pollo es innegablemente una comida reconfortante para muchas personas (especialmente cuando no se sienten bien) y esta versión obtiene una actualización saludable. Los fideos de huevo integrales agregan fibra y nutrientes, y el caldo de pollo reducido en sodio reduce el sodio. Por supuesto, use caldo de pollo casero si lo tiene.

Sopa de lentejas con chisporroteo picante

Simplemente chisporrotear un poco de pimentón y cayena en un poco de aceite de oliva es la llovizna perfecta para la sopa de lentejas en conserva.

Sopa toscana de espinacas, frijoles y salchichas

3
Las comidas típicas de la despensa, como los frijoles cannellini, la espinaca congelada y el caldo de pollo, hacen que esta sopa sea muy fácil de preparar en un ajetreado día de la semana. Haga que sea una comida: sirva con pan crujiente de grano entero y tomates en rodajas.

Caldo de pollo

1
Use los restos de una cena de pollo asado (después de quitar la carne) para hacer este caldo de pollo fácil.

Spicy Tofu Hotpot

11
Calienta una tarde fría con esta comida ligera pero satisfactoria de una olla. El tofu absorbe los sabores de este caldo fragante y picante, por lo que es todo menos sosa. Busque fideos frescos de estilo chino en la caja refrigerada de su supermercado junto con envoltorios de wonton.

Tomate picado, albahaca fresca y queso parmesano actualización sopa de tomate en conserva.

Sopa de pollo con hierbas provenzales

El uso de frijoles secos en lugar de enlatados en esta sabrosa sopa de pollo resulta en una sopa más espesa con un sabor más complejo. Haga una comida: sirva junto con Leek & Gruyere Quiche con Cherry Clafoutis para el postre.

Caldo de pollo hecho en casa

1
Nada calma, nutre y consuela como el caldo de pollo casero. El caldo en lata es un práctico recurso de reserva para sopas rápidas, pero hecho en casa brinda el máximo sabor a la vez que aporta calorías mínimas.

Caldo de carne

1
Los huesos de ternera son un caldo de carne gelatinoso y particularmente rico. Si no los tiene, sustituya la misma cantidad de huesos de carne. El paso de tostar los huesos, que imparte un sabor más completo, puede omitirse si el tiempo es corto.

Ragú de frijol picante y pimiento picante

1
Los tomates, los pimientos y los guisos de chipotle son los ingredientes clave en este sabroso ragú. La adición de frijoles hace que sea una comida completa.

sopa de elote

La leche evaporada sin grasa es la clave de esta versión reducida de la sopa de maíz clásica.

Sopa de cebolla asada

5
Las cebollas dulces caramelizadas, reforzadas con chalotes asados ​​y ajo, se combinan en una sopa deliciosa, pero no abrumadora.

Sopa de pepino y limón helado

Puede sustituir el eneldo, el cilantro o la albahaca por la menta en esta refrescante sopa de pepino y limón. Una manera fácil de hacer hielo picado es llenar la leche limpia o los cartones de jugo con agua y congelar. Luego coloque la caja de cartón en una bolsa de plástico grande y rompa con un martillo.

Sopa de jengibre y melón

2
